# dragInteraction(_:item:willAnimateCancelWith:)

**Instance Method**

Tells the delegate the system’s cancellation animation is about to start.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor optional func dragInteraction(_ interaction: UIDragInteraction, item: UIDragItem, willAnimateCancelWith animator: any UIDragAnimating)
```

## Parameters

- **interaction**: The interaction that called this method.
- **item**: The current drag item.
- **animator**: The animator that provides custom animations to run alongside the system’s animation. You can also use it to add a completion block that runs after the animations have finished.

## Discussion

This method is called for each drag item, whether it is visible or not.

To add a custom animation block that runs during the cancellation animation, pass the block to the animator’s [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIDragAnimating/addAnimations(_:)] method.

To add a completion block that runs after the cancellation animation has finished, pass the block to the animator’s [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIDragAnimating/addCompletion(_:)] method.

## Animating the drag behaviors

- **dragInteraction(_:willAnimateLiftWith:session:)**: Tells the delegate the system’s lift animation is about to start.
